us.ba3.me

Class MapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • GLSurfaceView
      • us.ba3.me.MapView

  • public class MapView
extends GLSurfaceView
    MapView is the primary way of interfacing with the Altus Mapping Engine.

      • setMaxVirtualMapParentSearchDepth

        public void setMaxVirtualMapParentSearchDepth(int levels)
        When a virtual map is displayed some tiles may be already cached and the search depth is how many levels lower than the target level to search for a tile in the cache to display when the target tile is not available.
        Parameters:
        levels - Default is 5

      • setMultithreaded

        public void setMultithreaded(boolean multithreaded)
        Toggles using single or multiple threads for threads managed by the map view
        Parameters:
        multithreaded - flag where true is multithreaded and false is singlethreaded.

      • setMaxTileRenderSize

        public void setMaxTileRenderSize(int tileSize)
        Sets the maximum tile size on screen. This minimum tile size on screen is half of the max.
        Parameters:
        tileSize - size in dp. Default is 380.

      • setTileLevelBias

        public void setTileLevelBias(float bias)
        The tile level bias helps balance between a uniform level of tiles on screen vs maintaining the max tile specified by setMaxTileRenderSize. A bias of 1 will attempt to move tiles up to one level towards the most common level for a particular view. In general this increases the number of tiles visible and memory usage for a tile map by a significant amount at small scales (when the view is zoomed out a significant ammount). With a bias of 0, traditional tiled raster maps with varied content per level can look odd at small scales because at one one view tiles of several different levels may be visible.
        Parameters:
        bias - Default is 1

      • setPanVelocityScale

        public void setPanVelocityScale(float panVelocityScale)
        Scales pan velocity at small scales. At large scales panning locks to geographic position of finger location
        Parameters:
        panVelocityScale - Default is 1

      • addMap

        public void addMap(java.lang.String mapName,
          java.lang.String mapSqliteFileName,
          java.lang.String mapDataFileName,
          boolean compressTextures)
        Add a map layer to the current view. The map must have been a map produced by the BA3 metool.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map for this view.
        mapSqliteFileName - The fully qualifed path/filename of the map's .sqlite file.
        mapDataFileName - The fully qualified path/filename of the map's .map data file.
        compressTextures - Whether or not raster data from the map should be compressed to 2-byte format internally.

      • addMBTilesMap

        public void addMBTilesMap(java.lang.String mapName,
                 java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String defaultTileName,
                 ImageDataType imageDataType,
                 boolean compressTextures,
                 int zOrder)
        Adds an MBTiles raster map. Generally, these maps are produced with TileMill from MapBox. The map is added using an internal native tile provider path. Map bounds and maximum zoom level are read from the MBTiles database. Internally, the mapping engine will use a completely native tile provider to load tiles from the MBTiles database and no extra image memory copies are ever created. This is the fastest way possible to load an MBTiles map using the mapping engine.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map layer
        fileName - Fully qualified path to the mbtiles filename
        defaultTileName - The name of a cached image to use if waiting for tiles to load.
        imageDataType - Inidicates whether the raster tiles are JPG or PNG
        compressTextures - YES to compress tile textures to a 2 byte format
        zOrder - Layer order for this map

      • addInternetMap

        public void addInternetMap(java.lang.String mapName,
                  java.lang.String tileUrl)
        Add a map layer that is composed of spherical mercator (slippy) projected tiles available on a web server. Map tiles will be downloaded and saved to the application cache director/mapName as jpeg or png images. Under the hood, the mapping engine is creating a virtual map layer, and using an instance of us.ba3.me.virtualmaps.InternetTileProvider as the TileProvider for the virtual map. This simple approach will work with internet-based maps from a variety of map sources.
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the map for this view.
        tileUrl - The URL that contains the map tiles, for example, to use MapQuest street map tiles you you would use http://otile1.mqcdn.com/tiles/1.0.0/osm

      • addMapUsingMapInfo

        public void addMapUsingMapInfo(MapInfo mapInfo)
        Adds a map layer whose type and properties are specified by a MapInfo object.
        Parameters:
        mapInfo - An MapInfo object or MapInfo derived object that specifies the map type and properties.

      • removeMap

        public void removeMap(java.lang.String mapName,
             boolean clearCache)
        Remove a map layer from the current view and optionally clear the internal caches. If caches are not cleared, and you re-enable the same map at a future point, cached data 'may' be used to draw the map. If you choose to clear the cache, the engine will re-request all map data if you later re-add that map. Whether or not you want to flush the cache depends on your scenario. For example, if your application has downloaded an updated map, you would want to remove the existing one and clear its data from the cache. If the user is just toggling a map on and off, you would not want to clear it data from the cache the cache.
        Parameters:
        mapName - The name of the map file (or layer name).
        clearCache - A boolean value that indicates whether or not to flush the map's data from the cache.

      • removeAllMaps

        public void removeAllMaps(boolean clearCache)
        Removes all maps currently displayed and optionally flushes the cache.
        Parameters:
        clearCache - True to clear cache.

        alpha - Value to set alpha to. Range is 0 to 1.

      • setDynamicMarkerAnchorPoint

        public void setDynamicMarkerAnchorPoint(java.lang.String mapName,
                               java.lang.String markerName,
                               PointF anchorPoint)
        Set a dynamic marker anchor point
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        anchorPoint - center of rotation in the marker image in pixels. An anchor point of (0,0) would rotate around the bottom left of the image

      • setDynamicMarkerOffset

        public void setDynamicMarkerOffset(java.lang.String mapName,
                          java.lang.String markerName,
                          PointF offset)
        Set a dynamic marker offset
        Parameters:
        mapName - Unique name of the dynamic marker map layer.
        markerName - Unique name of the marker to be updated.
        offset - offset in pixels to be applied after rotation. If the rotation is 0, and offset of (10,10) is equivalent to an anchor point of (10,10).

        Add a polygon to a dynamic vector map.
        Parameters:
        mapName - The name of the dynamic vector map to add the polygon to.
        points - An array of PointF objects where for each point, x = longitude and y = latitude.

        public void setTrackUpForwardDistance(double distance,
                             double animationDuration)
        Set the point distance from the bottom of the view on which the virtual camera is centered in track-up mode.
        Parameters:
        distance - Distance in 'points' from the bottom of the view.
        animationDuration - If non-zero, the number of seconds to animate the camera to the new center.
